poem:
"So Simple, The Verse of Dress"

Wide jeans, the cloak
of a day well met,
a hoodie, simple prophecy -
wardrobe's answer to stern reality. 

Life, a recipe of cloth and thread,
Familiarity - our comfort spread.
We meet the world, in attire so plain, 
A dance with hunger sated by denim's refrain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Think of them like the wardrobe equivalent of your go-to recipes. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
